The [github issue tracker](https://github.com/petkaantonov/bluebird/issues) is **_only_** for bug reports and feature requests. Anything else, such as questions for help in using the library, should be posted in [StackOverflow](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/bluebird) under tags `promise` and `bluebird`.

Yes. Since the start of ESLint, we've regularly filed bugs and feature requests with Esprima and will continue to do so. However, there are some different philosophies around how the projects work that need to be worked through. The initial goal was to have Espree track Esprima and eventually merge the two back together, but we ultimately decided that building on top of Acorn was a better choice due to Acorn's plugin support.

The structured nature of the Universal Mission Framework opens the door to numerous powerful future enhancements that can build upon the core platform.

Accuracy Ceiling: This method is fundamentally and irredeemably flawed. Tokenization is a complex, context-dependent process. Heuristics fail dramatically and unpredictably, especially with non-English languages (e.g., "Cómo estás" is 10 characters but 5 tokens), code, punctuation, and even capitalization. One analysis comparing a character heuristic to tiktoken found an error rate of 37% for a standard English text. No amount of enhancement—such as adding word-based ratios or special character handling—can overcome this fundamental limitation. The method will never achieve the accuracy required for reliable quota management.

2. **Intelligence Layer Enhancements** – Improve splitting guardrails, dependency summaries, and quality scoring outputs (Sprint 4 missions B4.1-B4.3).

| **Sprint 4 – Intelligence Layer Enhancements** | Improve practical usefulness of splitting, dependency, and quality tooling | • Tune heuristics, add guardrails for `split_mission`/`suggest_splits`
• Surface telemetry/alerts so authors see when intelligence outputs need manual review
• Produce dependency/quality summary outputs consumable by mission authors | Builds on mission history stored in flat files; keeps focus on core intelligence tools. |
